info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 29 at 3:26AM CDT until March 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Danger Conditions Expected Wednesday for South Texas... .Very dry air mass will move into south Texas Wednesday behind a frontal boundary. West-northwest winds will increase by mid- morning with gusts up to 35 mph expected through the day. The temperatures will warm into the upper 80s to lower 90s with relative humidity values falling to 8 percent over the Brush Country to 10-15 percent over the inland coastal plains. Critical fire danger conditions are expected from mid morning until early evening when wind speeds will diminish. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF SOUTH TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle...McMullen...Live Oak...Bee... Goliad...Victoria...Webb...Duval...Jim Wells...Inland Kleberg...Inland Nueces...Inland San Patricio...Coastal Aransas...Inland Refugio...Inland Calhoun...Coastal Kleberg... Coastal Nueces...Coastal San Patricio...Aransas Islands... Coastal Refugio...Coastal Calhoun...Kleberg Islands...Nueces Islands...Calhoun Islands. * TIMING...From 9 AM until 7 PM Wednesday * WIND...West-northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Around 8 percent Brush Country, 10-15 percent inland coastal plains, and 20-30 percent islands. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
